data.title: NY Maps, Demographics and Zip Codes List - MapOfZipCodes
data.meta_description: Explore comprehensive data about New York (NY) on our page. Dive into detailed zip codes, counties, maps, and other important data about New York. Whether you're relocating, planning a trip, or researching, find the accurate information you need about New York here.

Home

New York

New York Zip Code Maps | NY Maps, Demographics and Zip Codes List

Quick Page Links

* Figures are taken between July 2021 and July 2022.

New York Zip Code Products

Population Figures for New York

New York Population Between 2010 and 2019

The line chart presents the population in New York between 2010 and 2022. Back in 2010 there were 19,378,102 people living in the state of New York. Since then the population has decreased to 19,453,561 people.

Population Change Between 2010 and 2022

The line chart presents the population change in Alabama between 2010 and 2018. The population in New York has changed by an average of 18,232 residents in the 8 years this chart shows.

Births and Deaths Chart

This chart shows the births and deaths for New York between 2010 and 2018. We also show the latest 2022 data for this state.

Real Estate Figures

Households in New York

New York has approximately 7,652,666 as of the last US census in 2021. Below will find the figures for households, types of households, family types and more.

Most buildings are 2 Unit Structures in New York. You can see on the graph below that most buildings are occupied by Owners, with a 55/45 split.

Property Value in New York

Properties in New York have an average price of around $501,352. Most properties in this state are valued around $500,000 to $749,999 with 786,827 houses residing in this category.

Financial and Employment Figures for New York

Employment Status for Population Over 16

New York has an employment rate of 91%. A total of 9,226,373 are currently employed in this state.

How do Workers in New York Commute to Work?

You will see in the data below that the most popular method to commute in New York is by Car, Truck or Van Alone. A total of 4,439,902 people commute using this method.

Only 238,588 commute by Other in New York.

Occupation for New York Workers

Most workers in New York work in the Management, Business, Sciences and Arts sector. A total of 4,265,380 reported working in this sector during the last census.

The least popular sector for workers in New York is Natural Resources, Construction and Maintenance with just 620,059 people working there.

Most Popular Employment Industries

Education, Health Care and Social Care is the most popular industry for people in New York. 4,265,380 people work in the Education, Health Care and Social Care industry.

Income and Benefits Over the Past Year

New York has a median household income of $74,314 for the past 12 months. New York has a per capita income of $43,078 and median earnings are $43,462 for workers.

The mean retirement income is $30,639. A mean income of $5,653 is associated with public assistance in this state.

Salary Class, Health Insurance and Poverty Levels

You can see the three pie charts below showing the salary, health insurance and poverty statistics for New York.

Most people in this state earn their money through Private Wage and Salary. 7,145,887 people in New York earn their money this way. On the other end, 18,647 people are in the Unpaid Family category

0.948% of people have health insurance in this state. Unfortunately, 0.052% of people don't have any coverage in New York.

Education and Learning

Educational Attainment Level

As you can see from the column chart below; people in the age group of 45 to 64 with a High School Diploma are most likely to have a high-school diploma in the state of New York. Those most likely to have a batchelors degree are in the 45 to 64 with a Batchelors age group.

There are 276 colleges and universities in New York. Below you will find the full list for this state. Please feel free to download this data as a CSV or Excel file. Please get in touch if you need any other data or help.

In New York there are a total of 450. In the table below you will see every hospital and medical facility in this state. You can download the data to see all the information we have on each hospital.

There are a total of 1063 police and law enforcement locations in New York.

There are a total of 2,281 in New York 5 digit zip codes. You can use the list below to check which zip codes are in this state. Alternatively you can download the full list as an Excel file.

As you can see in the table below, there are 62 counties in the state of New York

New York has a total of 62 cities. You use the table or download link below to check which cities reside within the state.

Products for NY - New York Zip Codes

Frequently Asked Questions about New York

How many zip codes are there in New York

There are a total of 2,281 in New York 5 digit zip codes in the state of New York.

What is the zip code for New York?

The first zip code for New York is 1. The first number of a zip code refers to a specific region of the united state. The first number often covers more than one state.

What is the zip code area for New York?

New York has 20 area codes. Here is the list: 212, 315, 332, 347, 363, 516, 518, 585, 607, 631, 646, 680, 716, 718, 838, 845, 914, 917, 929, 934.
